website_summaries.verdict: All the features of the N79 with the bonus of being compatible with Alexa and Google Home.
pros: Can be controlled with an app or through Alexa or Google Home
Includes a max suction mode for deep cleaning
cons: Can sometimes have trouble finding its charging dock, especially if it's in another room

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t last 6 weeks
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this beebot n79s I really liked it. I received it on July 14th 2018 and have used I everyday since then but now on August 23 2018 it decided to stop working. The unit will only stay on for seconds. Just long enough for me to look at the battery life and it says its fully changed. Didn’t even last 6 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: I loved our Dusty from the first day we started using ...
customer_reviews.text: I loved our Dusty from the first day we started using it. I set it to go off daily while we were at work and returned nightly to a clean house and a dustbin to empty. Sadly, Dusty has decided to quit after just over a month. It keeps telling us that the drop sensors need to be cleaned however after multiple cleanings it still is not working. It worked great while it worked but expected better longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money they don't last .
customer_reviews.text: I've had three the 1st one malfunctioned immediately and amazon took it back . The second started to malfunction specifically just going in circles and then stopping the third did the same a few days later . I don't recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a product the lasts or at least carrys a warranty . I will be purchasing a more expensive one with a warranty and will only be doing that once.
customer_reviews.author: serina

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 1 year exactly
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: vacuum broke after 1 year. It runs for less than a minute then beeps and turns red. Super annoying. It’s cleaned out, fully charged, filters changed, nothing tangled in brushes. Something must be wrong with the sensors. So we are out $200! Very frustrating ————————- It’s ok. Difficult to clean the vacuum itself but once I got used to it I used it more often. Really nice while I wa pregnant, even if it doesn’t do an amazing job. Admittedly we are a house with two dogs- Sheltie and GSD so it’s no small thing to ask.
customer_reviews.author: River

customer_reviews.title: Love my ecovac
customer_reviews.text: We have two large dogs and therefore lots of dog hair. I purchased the ecovac thinking that it would help keep the dust and hair under control until I could vacuum on the weekends. This vacuum exceeded our expectations, we love it. It was so easy to use, even my husband can do it, without assistance. I think he actually likes it. My hardwood floors look and feel awesome. The dogs do not seem to notice or car about it, I was concerned they would eat it when I wasn't looking. I think if you decide to purchase this unit, you will be very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Do not recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this during Prime day and finally have time to set this up. Unfortunately, I kept getting the error message -wheel malfunction. The manual is not helpful either.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Should have known :(
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed. Mainly in myself. I shouldn’t have wasted my money on junk and should have just paid a little more for better quality. This vacuum barely made it 3 months, before it quit working completely. Tried all of the trouble shooting suggestions, but it’s dead. Cheap hunk of plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Alexandra Lamping

customer_reviews.title: Might be good to clean your bathroom floor
customer_reviews.text: Was very skeptical about buying one of these as the reviews were mixed. I went ahead and did it. It was great for about the first month, now not so much. It does pick up lots of dust, dirt and hair....when it actually works. It rarely makes it back to its home base, it may run for about 20 minutes then just stops. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fail of a vacuum
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t clean properly, just messes up the carpet. Can NEVER find the charging base, one time it literally took an hour finding the base in the same room and was still unable to find it, I had to manually walk it over.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph House

customer_reviews.title: 5 months after use and its garbage.
customer_reviews.text: after a fews months of use, this is how the bot acts now in the video. worked well the first month. Now, it barely picks up things... but would you wanna spend hundreds of dollars on something like this in the video? In this case, you’re buying a brand/idea of a luxury product that isnt even luxury. deebot also wont connect to your phone and will give you errors of non sense. after about 3 months, it would go straight to spots it gets stuck and make horrible noises until you go pull it out. just get a regular vacuum.
customer_reviews.author: BelissaLovely

customer_reviews.title: Save TONS OF TIME cleaning your home!
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have a Deebot I’d never go without one again! It’s so easy to use, just make sure it’s charged, push the auto button and it will clean the room. You can use the app, connect it to your WiFi and program the robot to run at a certain time. I can clean my living room, dining room and bathroom on one charge! Does an amazing job of picking up the wealth of dog and cat hair in our house in addition to dust and dirt. Make a BIG difference in my allergies when I started using this. Put it on, run your errands and your room is clean!
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Honeymoon over!!
customer_reviews.text: man this thing was sucking up baby socks, shopkins toys, and cleaning gloves, just an amazing bot but the 1st problem was the app , i was never able to connect with the app. Then it was down hill from there, battery life wasnt as long and eventually it doesnt even charge. so its charging now with no ability to be activated. I have not reach out to customer service nor did i buy an extended warranty, I will be returning this asap as much as i dont want too. UPDATE: WILL NOT HOLD CHARGE NOT EVEN FOR A FEW SECONDS!! TOTAL WASTE>...SAVE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.author: budfox7

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Used the cleaner 3 times and it stopped working. One of the wheels stopped retracting and it would only go in circles. It's going to be sent back. The randomness of the cleaning causes it to repeat some paths numerous times and not hit other areas.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Used maybe 5 times and one of the brushes won't spin. Waste of money. Cant even get a full refund for defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after one month. Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Stop working after one month. Very disappointing not satisfied. I paid $200.00
customer_reviews.author: Xindy

customer_reviews.title: Returned.
customer_reviews.text: If I were solely reviewing this vacuum, and based on about an hours use, I would give it at least 4 stars. Unfortunately, I discovered the problem that so many others are having, and that is getting the phone app to connect to the vacuum. After I don't how many attempts and how much time, I could never get the two to connect. I read through these comments and other places online and the seems to be a pretty common issue. Back in the box and returned. Seemed to work well otherwise. Quieter than my Roomba and liked the dual spinning brushes as opposed to the single I have now.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rylant

customer_reviews.title: Great little alternative to a Roomba
customer_reviews.text: I was so in love with this thing when it first arrived. It’s a must in my home with a German Shepherd and toddler. It was so quiet that you could actually run it while watching TV or while the kids were sleeping. Just shy of two months into having this and putting it to work every day.
customer_reviews.author: Karen M

customer_reviews.title: Lasted exactly one year from date of purchase
customer_reviews.text: After exactly one year of use ( runs an average of two days a week), we started getting a "Main Brush Failure" message. Seems the main brush no longer turns. Took Deebot apart and everything is intact. Must be a burned out motor or circuit board issue.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Good little robot
customer_reviews.text: We are very happy with it. We have it set to clean every evening, and it starts up and takes off. There are a few spots in the house that give it problems: the wedge-shaped base of a floor fan, for instance. Every couple days we will find it stuck, plaintively beeping for help. Poor thing. Anyway, I'll pick him up and send it off in a different direction so he can finish his rounds. Sometimes he has trouble getting over a curled edge of an area rug and we will both look down from our television watching and offer words of encouragement. "Come on, boy! You can do it!" Things are different, now that the children have gone.
customer_reviews.author: pmata1

customer_reviews.title: wall sensors on all replacements failed.
customer_reviews.text: The first ones wall sensors failed and i returned it before 1 month. Now the replacements wall sensors have failed 13 days after receiving it and its ramming into the walls. I ordered a 3rd unit and its wall sensors have now failed its clear now that this all units will fail like this. Without the walk sensors it wont slow down begore it gets to the wall and it gets caught in places since it cant see anything. Dont buy wall sendors will fail.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Its good cleaning quality and sensors are good as well
customer_reviews.text: Its good cleaning quality and sensors are good as well. However, it takes too long time to clean the room on auto mode and mostly repeat same area and leave some parts - have it sometime manually navigate to get full cleaning quickly. Battery is good and last for full 2 bedroom, living, kitchen cleaning at once. I love the App controls via wifi. Charge very slowly. Its been 6 months purchased. Battery charging has gone tremendously slow. Also deebot sensors not working at all and it's circling around one place on any mode
customer_reviews.author: KP

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for pets hair!
customer_reviews.text: Love it ! Since I purchased I haven’t use my regular Vacum. I set it to clean automatically every night and it keeps living room wooden floor clean. I have 2 dogs an a cat it’s amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Sylceuz

customer_reviews.title: Save up and buy a roomba
customer_reviews.text: This product is terrible. Granted- it “vacuums” as in, it will suck up dust & dirt but the ease and user friendly ability of this device is comical. It’s been over 2 months now and it hasn’t “learned” the layout of my home, it continually gets stuck in between the couch and side table and will continuously head Butt the table until you manually pick it up and reposition it. And lastly, now the app won’t even work! And yet my WiFi works totally fine. This is a piece of junk. Save your money and buy a Roomba
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Gets stuck so easily on so many things!
customer_reviews.text: So, I used an ILife A4 for a couple years, loved it till it died. Got this guy and feels great, cleans great, awesome alexa features, but it gets stuck on everything! My old cheaper vacuum never got stuck but this guy... Man. My tables legs, it can't always get over them but it shouldn't even be trying. It should be stopping but it goes right on. And worst of all, gets stick on my fridge door every freaking time... This guy is a disappointment...
customer_reviews.author: Franky

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum itself is impressive, but it failed after just 3 months. Symptoms are runs for 1.5 minutes and then stops and gives 4 beeps with red light. Customer Service has been responsive, but such a hassle to go through all the trouble shooting with them to prove to them that their unit is broke so inconvenient. Update: They did replace the unit with a new one. I was expecting a dirty reconditioned unit so satisfied that they replaced with new (which is what I originally paid for). Lets see how this one holds up. If I don't post back, must be good.... else? well... stay tuned :)
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W.

customer_reviews.title: our model was faulty
customer_reviews.text: Our device did a reasonable job of cleaning the hard floor but had trouble with the low pile carpet. However it insisted on doing it at 4:30 in the morning. We tried everything in the book plus phoning the service department to remove this very bad habit but it would continue to wake us up every morning. We returned it to Amazon and were very pleased on how fast we were credited with our funds. Will probably repurchase a model M88 that we have at another location that is worth the additional money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: The idea of a machine doing your sweeping for you is great! But don't waste your money it doesn't do a Good job vacuuming. Always gets stuck on my thin rug by the door. Runs into my dark shelves/couches and doesn't know how to fix itself. You spend more time babysitting/fixing the robot. Would have been better off just sweeping with a broom myself. Wouldn't recommend, not impressed.
customer_reviews.author: mariah thomas

customer_reviews.title: No coverage to entire floor plan for a small one bed
customer_reviews.text: First of all. I hv a small one bedroom with a sunken living room. So I expect this robot to just run my kitchen, entry way and bedroom but it is not able to find the way to my bedroom at all! And it can’t go into my bathroom.. so I got the Roomba which was prefectly fine to run every where! If you don’t hv a open floor plan. Don’t get this robot. It is lower noise than roomba
customer_reviews.author: Piggy

customer_reviews.title: Don’t
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t return home. Is not smart enough or powerful enough
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than a Roomba
customer_reviews.text: This is my second robotic vacuum cleaner. I wasn’t sure what to expect since it was relatively inexpensive. It does twice the job of the Roomba and I like the remote and Alexa feature. I have a Siberian Husky, so the machine gets a daily workout. It is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: S. Feller

customer_reviews.title: A great cheaper alternative to Roomba.
customer_reviews.text: The real question is "does it suck?" yes, yes it does. It did a great job sucking up dust bunnies, pet hair and dirt. On it's first night out I ran it on two floors mostly hardwood and 2 carpeted bedrooms. It's replacing a 5 year old roomba so it has a lot more features. It's quieter than the roomba, the accessories (filters, etc) are cheap and I like the edge cleaning. It comes with a physical remote and you can control it via the Ecovacs app. There is an Alexa app for the phone as well. Alexa integration is limited but funcitonal: Alexa ask deebot to start cleaning.. Alexa ask deebot to stop. Alexa ask deebot to start charging.
customer_reviews.author: datamushroom

customer_reviews.title: Dusty stopped being a reliable appliance....🤨
customer_reviews.text: It has stopped working after five months. It was great the first two months but gradually stopped. Dusty could go over the comfort mat in my kitchen...but no more. He cleaned under furniture. He was a joy until he started missing places on the floor and stopping for no reason. He would beep several times and need to be restarted. I bought the extended warranty. Help! I talked to a rep from ECOVACS BEFORE CHRISTMAS 2018. He verified that my vacuum needed to be returned. I needed to send him the proof of purchase. I sent the wrong thing... help me replace or get a refund,please.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Handles rugs like a champ
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about purchasing this because we have a lot of rugs on our hardwood floors, but decided to give it a try. I'm so glad I did. This little guy doesn't have any problem with any of our rugs (but our dyson does). It doesn't have the power of the dyson, of course, but it really seems to do the job just fine. The best part about having "him" around is that lots of areas that haven't been vacuumed in years are getting done now. He goes under beds, couches, dressers... just about everywhere. I just wish we would have gotten this sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Smith

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Robot Vacuum for a small apartment and it did not hold up at all. I was able to use it for a WHOLE 2 DAYS before it stopped charging. ECOVACS support was pretty frustrating and unhelpful as well. Even when it was working, I was not really impressed. It's not very smart and there seems to be no rhyme or reason to the vacuum pattern. The "spot" clean function was alright though. I am getting a full refund as I'm not very confident in this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: WORST robo vac on the market
customer_reviews.text: Would give this a negative 5 stars if I could.. Got this vacuum two years ago and the battery died within one year so we had to buy a new one. Despite our constant changing of the brushes its screeches and rattles so loud that you can hear it even from out side of the house and it is unbearable to listen to. Worst robot vacuum I've ever seen. Very disappointed with this company and their customer service. Reached out to them several times about these issues only to be sent instructions to turn it off and back on again. Yeah right, huge waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Kadee

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This vacuum gets stuck constantly. It has a hard time finding the base when the battery is low. It consistently misses dirt and debris on the floor, and leaves entire sections of my house untouched. It does not get corners or areas against the wall very well either. I no longer use this $200 machine. Complete waste of money. Wish I had bought a Roomba.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Adams

customer_reviews.title: Short life
customer_reviews.text: Just shy of one year (within the warranty) the Deebot would beep incessantly when charging. I contacted customer service but got no reply. A search showed many people had the same problem. The machine was still working so I continued to use it but it became less and less convenient, beeping error signals several times while working. Now it only will vacuum about 15 minutes before needing to be recharged. This machine had basically an 11 month life. I not only won't be replacing with another of this brand, I probably won't even try with another robot vacuum brand.
customer_reviews.author: Ax Chase

customer_reviews.title: One of the best purchases we've ever made! Bought 3 of them!
customer_reviews.text: We bought our Debot in Nov. 2017. We have pets and the constant battle was pet hair. We run our Debot every day and we seldom see any pet hair at all. Downstairs we have granite, wood, and tile floors with Persian rugs. We couldn't be happier. We also bought one for my elderly mother and she loves it! It makes her life so much easier. We bought another Debot in 2018 for our upstairs which is mostly carpeted. It also does a great job! It is amazing because it stops at the top of the steps and turns around with no problems! We highly recommend this product to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Susan B.

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, only for a year.
customer_reviews.text: It worked ok for the first year. After that it started losing battery very soon, but worst of all, stops every few seconds with no reason. We check it, everything seems nice and clean, we press the start button again, it works for a few seconds and then stops again. Of course we are off warranty since it was for one year...
customer_reviews.author: Coel

customer_reviews.title: It will last a year
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy I would recommend buying the I robot. I bought this a little over a year ago and it sits on the charger and beeps. I called customer service twice first time I was told to clean the main brush. I did that and it did not fix the problem. The second time I called I was told to do the same thing it took for ever to get them to understand I already did it then I was told I needed a new battery guess what that didn’t work either. I did some internet research and found out this seems to be a common problem.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working 6 months after 1-year warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: When it worked, the vacuum did OK. Patterns seemed random, and the floors always felt cleaner afterward. Run time was long (not efficient) and it's a little loud. However, it stopped working after 1.5 years. Bought a replacement battery to see if that would fix it - it didn't Customer support told me replacing the brush would fix it, so I sank more money in trying to avoid buying a new vacuum... but that didn't work. I also spent a lot of time taking the thing apart piece-by-piece to clean everything, including the motor. Nothing worked, and it's about 6 months outside of the 1-year warranty, so there's nothing more to be done other than find a better brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten Welch

customer_reviews.title: It dies after warranty
customer_reviews.text: The first year was great. I was very impressed with the cleaning it did. It was nice to (for once) not have to sweep the floor everyday. Immediately after the warranty expired, it started having very short battery life issues. We didn’t think much of it. Then it started not fully charging. A few weeks later it started beeping. That was annoying. We’re still ran it a bit. But it started missing bigger swatches and not even being able to clean a full room before dying. I’m really disappointed. I do not recommend getting this vacuum (Unless you like machines that go “beep”).
customer_reviews.author: MandHJ

customer_reviews.title: Buy this Deebot!! Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I have held off on buying one of these vacuums for years, because I have dogs and kids and have thought it would just be a bigger hassle than a help. At the prodding of a friend, I finally bought it and it is AMAZING. I used to use three to four swiffer cloths to sweep the house, now it’s only one and it’s not even bad. It just really does an amazing job of keeping my floors clean, all the dog hair and cat hair (i have two dogs and two cats) and also my own long hair! I’m super happy with this product and would definitely buy it again. If you’re on the fence, jump!!
customer_reviews.author: Kaili Moran

customer_reviews.title: The customer service is AMAZING. Does a great job at keeping the floors clean.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful robot. After about 4 months, the robot started beeping for absolutely no reason, it seemed to work but with bizarre glitches. There was some sort of a malfunction. I contacted their customer service department. We went back and forth for a few days trying to troubleshoot. I sent them videos and pictures. The issue couldn't get resolved so they sent me a replacement. Between the time I shipped the defective one and the time I received the new one, about 5 days had passed, and it was obvious that the robot wasn't there (we don't have time to vacuum daily and it does a darn good job at cleaning out floors). Wonderful unit for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Al

customer_reviews.title: Cleans well but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Vacuum worked well when it worked but it didn't last. It did a great job cleaning pet hair on hard floors. Navigation was pretty standard for bump-and-run vacs but it had some issues getting stuck on higher thresholds at times. The first one had battery issues in 7 months and was replaced under warranty. However the warranty replacement failed with a main brush issue after 8-9 months. Only ran it twice a week so it wasn't overused or abused. Support was not helpful as warranty is only good for a year from purchase date and not a year on new devices. Ultimately not worth the money for how long it lasted.
customer_reviews.author: nmartens

customer_reviews.title: It's a decent robot vac for the price but does not last
customer_reviews.text: Just threw away my Deebot. It made it about 2 years. The battery started lasting long enough for about 20 minutes of cleaning. Overall, this vacuum is just okay. It works good enough to keep from having to manually vacuum very often, but performance definitely degraded over time. It loves to smash into things to determine where to go and it pretty much just runs around random. I just replaced it with a Shark and the difference in quality is night and day. The Shark blows this away. In summary, if you want to save money and are fine with just an okay vacuum, then this is for you.
customer_reviews.author: Redryder

customer_reviews.title: Decent while it lasted
customer_reviews.text: We used this for over a year. It constantly got stuck on EVERYTHING the couch, the rug, the vent covers...yes vent covers every single time it got stuck on all of our vent covers. We had to babysit while running it. It did do a great job when it would work. Now it runs for a few minutes and stop working. I did some research and this seems normal that it stops working after a year or so. People stated they could take it apart and put it back again. We purchased two other brands at the same time as this one and the other two are still working and had way less babysitting.
customer_reviews.author: Little Miss Loving

customer_reviews.title: Works Great for a Year Now
customer_reviews.text: This is a good robot vacuum cleaner, having used it for over a year now. It is easy to charge, easy to use and easy to clean. It works both on the rug and the wood floors, picking up all hair and dust along the way. It never fell off the stairs. It seems to walk randomly, but seems to cover all the room after two hours and get back to dock itself automatically. My only concern is that it does not recognize dark objects, and bump onto it occasionally.
customer_reviews.author: Suibian

customer_reviews.title: It's get the job done, if you don't ask much. Battery started to fail.
customer_reviews.text: I had this vacuum for almost two years. I used it once a week at most. I liked that is not very noisy and gets the job done. However, it's not very intelligent at all. It just bumps from one place to the other, and can get stuck in one room (I live on an apartment), or just move to another room without actually cleaning where it was. Overall, it collects dirt, and that's ok. Battery already started to die, and now it only works for about 50 minutes before it needs to get a recharge again. I don't think that is good, considering the use I had for it.
customer_reviews.author: galbin

customer_reviews.title: Loud but works
customer_reviews.text: The N79S is super loud - it sounds as if there is something loose rattling inside of it. Had an N79 before and it was very quiet by comparison. The N79S is also taller than the N79 and it did pose some problems when trying to clean under the kitchen cabinets. The side brushes on this model are different lengths whereas the N79 had side brushes that were all equal lengths - not sure why this is the case. The app is a nice convenience. All in all it does the job but wish it were quieter!
customer_reviews.author: EllaBee

customer_reviews.title: Time Saving At It’s Best
customer_reviews.text: I had little hope the vacuum cleaner and me would part anytime soon. After rescuing a 110 lb Great Pyrenees, my hardwood floors usually have huge white tumbleweeds blowing under furniture and straddling tables. So, I thought what the heck. Let me give the Deebot a try? Hands down its been a gift of time, immaculate floors & entertainment for Obi (my Pyr). It easily picks up debris on the Persian carpets & is so quiet I sometimes forget it’s rolling around the rooms. Five stars for the Deebot. Thinking of sending my sister one. She has Bernese Mountain dogs!
customer_reviews.author: Deb D.

customer_reviews.title: I LOVED but then died after a year :(
customer_reviews.text: I’m so sad to be having problems with this VAC after only 8 months of use. It was working so well and then all of a sudden started stopping for no reason. No boundaries, no rugs. I deep cleaned and restarted the device multiple times thinking it just needed a “reboot”. I love this vacuum but very disappointed that it stopped not even a year after purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Leartis Jay McMillan

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy! Ecovac will leave you high and dry when the warranty ends!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy! When I got this I loved it! But here I am 15 months later and my deebot is not working. I contacted the company and all they had to say was sorry it is no longer under warranty. We provide a 1-year limited warranty on the whole machine. If we find the issues that you are experiencing are related to product quality, we will definitely resolve your problems and concerns. We regret to inform you that after reviewing the information provided, your warranty claim has been denied under the terms of our limited manufacturer’s warranty and we will not be able to provide you with a replacement product.
customer_reviews.author: regular amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Even Better Than Our Previous Model
customer_reviews.text: This is actually the third Deebot we've had, thanks to Ecovacs' excellent service when something goes wrong. This new model seems to have undergone not only the Max Power and Alexa upgrades, but a better navigation algorithm. It rarely gets hung up, less so that the older model. In any case, we love Hazel 2 even more than the last Deebot. And, despite all the disclaimers from Ecovacs, we almost never have to use our Dyson anymore, even when we need to vacuum away all the fur from our kid's Siberian Husky, when she visits overnight (and that's a lot of tough fur!).
customer_reviews.author: Dehypnotist

customer_reviews.title: Random navigation! Inefficient!
customer_reviews.text: The price is pretty high for a random navigation robot. I had to return this product to get a deebot 900 which is only $245 with smart laser navigation and virtual boundaries using the deebot app. This robot is good for a small and a single room only. It will get stuck often and navigation inefficiently and miss a lot of spots. The good things are that this robot can schedule auto cleaning on the remote and the app. The suction is strong. That's about it. I personally don't like random navigation robot. It's pointless to have a robot which gets stuck and needs attention often and misses a lot of spots.
customer_reviews.author: Vu Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Bangs into everything (new model and replacement)
customer_reviews.text: I bought due to high reviews on entry level. However, this model just bangs into everything. Sometimes the sensors work but not often. So I listen to it crash into everything. I engaged customer services, they deflect to a random person on YouTube to clean the screen. That’s not good when the company itself does not manage the issue. I complained enough to get a replacement, same issue. I’m in a small apartment mostly wood floors. It’s a no brainer, not used a lot, easy clean. Avoid this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Anzelc

customer_reviews.title: Don't want to miss it anymore
customer_reviews.text: I need to look for it every day since it usually gets lost or squared in between chairs or other furniture. But even with that search activity I don't want miss it anymore. Ours is running every for the last 5 months. Batterycharge is usually good for a good hour on medium high carpet.
customer_reviews.author: ZT

customer_reviews.title: This Vacuum Changed My Life!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know how I lived without the deebot, it’s truly life changing. With a toddler and a dog, our floors are constantly dirty, but now with the Deebot the mess is much more manageable. I bought this on a whim on prime day and honestly had low expectations. After having it for over a month I don’t know how I could ever live without this little thing! I’m constantly blown away by how much dirt it picks up and I feel like a proud mom when it finds it’s way back “home” to the charging station lol you will not regret buying this! Totally house cleaning game changer.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey M

customer_reviews.title: Probably not..
customer_reviews.text: I bought 5 of these a year ago. 1 for my grown children and 1 for me. My 4 kids report really liking theirs still and I liked mine a lot too for the first 3-4 months, but it started beeping (2 beeps) and then it simply shuts off about 30 seconds after it starts. It’s not a battery problem though. I know what it sounded like when the battery was low. It’s not that. And it’s fully charged. It just beeps and stops abruptly. Nothing in the troubleshooting addresses this problem. It’s too expensive to have this kind of problem without having a simple solution.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is the worst!
customer_reviews.text: Never got it to connect to Alexa or the app. Absolutely the WORST customer service! I called the company 3 times for help connecting. They are reading off a script and are very hard to understand. They wanted me to change all the router settings. I have 50 smart bulbs in the house and other things that work with Alexa. I didn’t want to screw up them. So I’m sending it back Amendment- so I called Amazon Customer Support and they found that my iPhone update was TOO UP TO DATE! (🙄). It’s still made for Operating System 9.0 or EARLIER! Go Amazon! It’s pretty bad when you get more help from Amazon than you do From the selling company!
customer_reviews.author: Anna-Liisa McAdams

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I put off this review for a while, I wanted to review it after it really got used and the "new toy" feeling faded. Well... its been about 3 months. I love it just as much as the first day. Its great!! It works great on carpet and hardwood floors. Easy to clean, has a good sized debris tray. The random navigation is a little nutty but if you just ignore it surprisingly it hits dang near everywhere somehow. Chairs and table legs are its arch nemesis, so to be nice we pull everything away from the table. I highly recommend. Especially for the price this is by far the best robot random navigation vacuum out there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't work straight from the box!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned an ecovac before, it wasn't the best machine but I was satisfied. Ordered this one, read the instructions and waited for it to charge. Went to start it up and it didn't work, the beep suggested it was for a problem with the waste tank. Wrote to support, exchanged multiple emails going back over information I had already provided. The fix they suggested was to put tape over a sensor to try to trick it into working, for a brand new machine. Customer service was slow, at best 1 email a day, and rather disinterested in the whole issue.
customer_reviews.author: Charles W

customer_reviews.title: Has flaws, but there’s ways around them
customer_reviews.text: First of all, Ecovacs customer service is great. They rely to emails in minutes. The biggest flaw is that the front visor eventually will get scratched up from regular wear and tear, which will impede the infrared sensors and completely kill the collision detection. Ecovacs suggested that I clean it with plastic polish, which actually works. However, that doesn’t work forever, and after 6 months my vacuum had no collision detection. It kept smashing into everything. I warrantied the product out via Ecovacs, and this time around I’ve decided to cover the front visor with shipping tape to protect it from scuffs and scratches.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Died at 17 months
customer_reviews.text: We loved our deebot it worked very well, hair would mess up the side brushes pretty bad so you needed to keep it clean. At the 17 month mark it but the dust. It drives around in clean mode but acts like its looking for the charger (no vacuum, slow speed, slow brush). It only has a 12mo warranty. So it's not worth having. Our shark vacuum we have had for 8 years and cost $160. This is a $250 vacuum and last d $17 months plus multiple replacement brushes which get pretty pricey so a 17 month operating cost is about $310 which is about $18.25/mo. VS the $1.67/mo of my shark.
customer_reviews.author: USMCSurvivalist85

customer_reviews.title: Company does not stand behind their product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in april, 2018 and it worked great up until now (September 2019). It keeps giving a 4 beep alarm which according to the manual indicates a main brush malfunction. I replaced it, called the phone number for ecovacs customer service, followed all the troubleshooting advice and then finally emailed them tonight. Despite it only being 1.5 years old, they had no further tips for me to fix this and basically said too bad. I'm not happy at all that I spent over $200 for it to last 1.5 years and for the company not to seem to care at all. I would never buy from this company again based on this experience.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Corey

customer_reviews.title: Debot rocks
customer_reviews.text: I am completely shocked how much dust this vacuum gets up when I open the tray to empty it. Even when the floor has recently been cleaned, debot finds the dust that has settled. Very efficient and effective. Warning: Gets stuck if the couch or bed is slightly higher than Debot's height. It will beep loudly to let you know it has stopped. I use a sneaker to plug up the places where Debot will get stuck. Confidentially, it has told me it appreciates my doing so as being stuck is never any fun.
customer_reviews.author: Fabritzio Fineburg

customer_reviews.title: Really really really GREAT
customer_reviews.text: The house is cleaner than ever. Not just the floors, there is less dust on the furniture too. We have wood and tile floors with Persian carpets. It goes up over carpet edges, even fringe, without issue. Seems to move randomly but it is not quite random. We occasionally sweep out corners just pushing the dust/dirt out a little for the robot to get. No vacuuming in over 2 months. At first it would fill up everyday. Now the whole house is cleaner and it can run for days without emptying.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Great start but performance starting to go down
customer_reviews.text: Used this initially to replace broken standard vacuum. Did lots of research and bought this one. Was very pleased for a good while, both in cleaning, charge and app use. However performance is starting to diminish I have been very consistent in cleaning and servicing as well as replacing parts as indicated. I know it’s not totally programmable but in auto mode it seems now to go more over the same areas again and again then all over. The app has stopped allowing me to manually direct it like it did when I first downloaded it so that’s a pain. It also seems harder for it to locate the charging base as easy as it did when it was newer.
customer_reviews.author: Matt T.

customer_reviews.title: Five stars on the vacuum, 1 star on the app.
customer_reviews.text: I love the vacuum, it died just before the one year mark. Contacted customer service and it was replaced with a small amount of back and forth emails. However the app recently updated and it now required access to unnecessary permissions on the phone to work. It now requires access to your phones IMEI and the phone itself as if it needed to make calls. ECOVACS, why does a wi-fi vacuum need access to these permissions? This is starting to encroach into PII territory. So now I have a choice to provide you unnecessary personal information or my vacuum is crippled. Sounds like extortion.
customer_reviews.author: Heywood

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few uses
customer_reviews.text: it worked fine about 5 times and then died. I bought a replacement battery and that didn't fix the issue. While it worked: Pros: much more silent than the Roomba, good suction. Good cheaper vacuum if it had lasted Cons: broke after 5 uses. Gets stuck much more easily than the Roomba, I need to be present to get it unstuck under chairs or rugs or dishwasher (Roomba never got stuck). There's no top handle to grab it and move it easily. if it had lasted I would have given it a 4 star for the value, since it's useless, 0 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Robo vacum
customer_reviews.text: I like the way this vacuum dusts my hardwood floors. It keeps the dust off the floors so that they shine all the time. I also like the app, it allows me to start the vacuum while no one is home in a regular basis so my floor get vacuumed everydayI I love this little guy, but it not good for deep cleaning, but great for surface cleaning. The transition from hardwood, carpet and tile is also great, it goes into my bathrooms too where I have ceramic tile and sweeps up all the hair from combing and brushing my hair. This vacuum does a lot for the price. Great deal!
customer_reviews.author: Janice M. Putman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed TWICE!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this in September of 2019. It ran fine for a while, but then the unit would stop in the middle of a cleaning with an error code, usually "Brush malfunction". I contacted the company within a couple of months and after some diagnosis they determined that the unit was bad. They sent a return label and after about 10 days sent us a replacement. This unit, too, started acting up soon thereafter. Same error code and the same diagnosis by their tech dept. We just received our 3rd unit and will not be opening the box. At this point I don’t know what to do with it, but I sure know that we don’t want it!
customer_reviews.author: Wisconsin Mike

customer_reviews.title: It just stopped working...product support is useless.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product and was very excited to see how well it worked, until it didn't. It stopped working at the beginning of December and after calling the customer service department, I was left with a problem that has yet to be resolved. It is now New Year's Eve, and I have very little recourse but to return the thing, if the customer service department will ever take responsibility for a product that fails within 30 days of purchase. After contacting the manufacturer and the warranty company, I am dissatisfied with the product, Asurion and Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle M Sutton

customer_reviews.title: Dead after just over 1 year - failure prone and no replacement parts
customer_reviews.text: Both this Sept. 2018. It's been 1.5 years, and one of the wheels will no longer turn, so this just spins around and goes nowhere. For the price of this, was hoping that it will last longer. Have had other brands (Shark) before and have not had failures this quick. Contacted customer service, and they are unable to sell replacement parts. Instead, they recommend sending this to a 3rd party repair center. Our EUFY robotic vacuum in the meantime is working fine, so goodby to the Deebot.
customer_reviews.author: J. W.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't go back to charger...EVER
customer_reviews.text: It works well. It just won't return to the charger when it's done. I was really disappointed that it didn't dock back since an important feature for me was that I wouldn't have to plug it in manually. It appears to have run out of battery and it won't recognize smaller obstacles. Edit: have had it for a few months and every single morning it gets stuck on literally nothing. I've cleaned the brush, emptied the bin, pulled out any hairs on the outer bristles. It never goes back to the charging station or if it does it'll get stuck right ON TOP while not quite reaching the charging pad... Seriously dumb robot
customer_reviews.author: E.

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a very helpful device
customer_reviews.text: It will be two years soon since I’ve had my Deebot N79S and I made a great choice and investment. I use it specially in all the rooms and bathroom and also where I have my carpet in the living room the rest of the house I broom it myself because of course it needs to charge after all the dust cleaning. It does the job perfectly! As per the bad comments I’ve read, I mean! People should know what the machine does and does not before purchasing it other than criticizing its performing. I think it’s a great device
customer_reviews.author: Isai Olivera

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend!
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted a robot vacuum for awhile now and decided to purchase one during the black friday sales. I chose this one because of the price and reviews. I have not been disappointed in it yet! We have scheduled the vacuum to run every weekday afternoon and it makes it back to the charging port about 3 out of 5 times mostly because it's eaten something that's been left on the ground that shouldn't be there. I've been really impressed with how much dirt and dust that this vacuum picks up. I would highly recommend this vacuum:)
customer_reviews.author: Battema's

customer_reviews.title: I love it!
customer_reviews.text: Oh, my goodness. I love the Deebot! I wanted to try a robotic vacuum and didn't want to pay several hundred dollars for one. . This one is supposedly an intro level and I got it on deal of the day. I did check reviews and I checked outside of Amazon reviews. It was rated in the top 5. I have 3 cats and 1 dog with hardwood floors and area rugs and only have time to vacuum on the weekends which results in fur tumbleweed. I run the Deebot ever other evening on auto and my floors look awesome! It's a must have.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: We just built a new home. 2700 square feet. It is 80% ceramic tile and the rest are rugs other than three carpeted bedrooms. This robot vacuum is outstanding! It does everything as advertised. Works great! We close the doors to the bedrooms and let it do the work on the major areas of the house. Handles different thickness rugs effortlessly and always goes back to the charger on its own. For the price it is a fantastic bargain. I have many friends who spent three times more on robotic cleaners and they are all pissed that ours is as good or better than theirs at a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: PZ

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy if you want scheduled cleanings
customer_reviews.text: The suction is fine. But if you’re like me, you want to schedule cleanings during the day while you’re at work. If that’s you, do NOT buy this product. The scheduling feature DOES NOT WORK. It acts like it never knows what day it is. If you set it to run M-F at 07:30, it’ll run at 07:30 on random days, and sometimes not at all. I’ve been in contact with warranty support which is via email. They aren’t helpful. It takes weeks to get through all the troubleshooting steps then they send you a replacement that has the same problem. Repeat the support process. At the end, your vacuum still doesn’t work, but your amazon return window has ended.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M.

customer_reviews.title: Rumba or Another Brand The Robotic Vacuum Is Here To Stay, Get Yourself One & See....
customer_reviews.text: It's an Ecovacs Deebot N795 vacuum cleaner my first this type it is a very cool device and very practical. I reside in a two story home and it cleans our top floor all carpet except for bathroom floors and does a descent job. It does manage to figure out how to go from room to room. One bathroom with a granite threshold makes it a bit difficult to maneuver over it with our exterior shower mat placed by the door problem solved. I have also the Rumba brand working on our ceramic tile flooring doin a good job as well. Arnie
customer_reviews.author: Arnie

customer_reviews.title: Works well/handy- unsupported WiFi won’t allow Alexa linkage
customer_reviews.text: Convenient Item for spot vacuuming, runs well with very little issue—and when there is issue it’s because I forgot to pick something up; completely my fault. My only disappointment is that the item description states that it would work with my Alexa device, however I am unable to connect it to the WiFi successfully. The remote that comes with the item pretty much suffices anyhow. My wood floors generally look spotless since using this item, overall good product for the $160.00 I had paid.
customer_reviews.author: Dippindots

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Robot for $250
customer_reviews.text: I got this on sale for $250 and it is well worth it. We have an old Roomba (960 I think) and it is LOUD but this sucker could run at night and you would never know it until you stepped on it going to the bathroom in the middle of the night! I plan on buying his big brother as I need the ability for room by room programmable cleaning but this guy does an excellent job. He would just be better if I could focus on one or two rooms per night. If you catch it for $250 or less, buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Don Powell

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this dang thing dies in the middle of the room more than anything. It has literally never returned to even the area the home dock is in. It’s louder than I anticipated. We can literally hear when it starts running upstairs. It gets stuck on cords (like to a fan or lamp) all the time and then just stays there until it dies. Our internet speed is basically too fast for it to even connect to. So the app is basically useless as it always shows the bot is “offline”. It bumps into things and then completely changes direction so it can run until it dies and still miss half the room.
customer_reviews.author: Teri

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.text: I have been going back and forth for years about getting one of these robot vacuums and I must say this is one of the best decisions I have made when it comes to cleaning. We have two dogs that she’d like crazy and we were normally cleaning every day which takes a lot out of the week. Now I have this set for when we’re at work so I come home to a clean home everyday and it’s one less thing to deal with. I tell everybody I can about this! It’s much cheaper then some of the others and yet still worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: Themessengerimage

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Works very well, but sometimes it gets stuck by heavy objects when it's making its rounds. Controls indicate how it would circulate around a room, do edges, spot clean, moves over carpet edges, and other things I haven't tried yet. If it gets stuck in a corner, you have to get up and move it. When you push the 'home' button, it goes to its docking place. Neat. This would be fantastic for cleaning an empty basketball court. :) If it ever comes with a mopping aspect, I will get one.
customer_reviews.author: LilyB

customer_reviews.title: Started out well
customer_reviews.text: It worked well at first (hard wood). We didn't love that it's path was random, but running it every day made that a non-issue. But over time, it's missing more and more hair. We replace the brushes, roller, and filters even more than suggested, as well as periodic cleaning of them before they need replacing. It used to suck up hair from a few inches away, and now it can only get the hair if it goes directly over it. We basically got just under 1year of good use, and now we're looking for something better.
customer_reviews.author: BeeLDub

customer_reviews.title: DUSTY ROCKS
customer_reviews.text: So Alexia clued us into this special pricing on the unit. On the spur of a moment it was purchased. Waited to give as a gift for Christmas. Dusty was named and set up on 12-26. worked awesome. Ran two times a day. picked up all kinds of dust and dirt each and everytime. (DONT JUDGE, we have pets and love the windows open) well.. fast forward to a few months of hard work... one of his little foot sockets started making noise and eventually stopped rotating. I contact Customer Support and within one week i had a new Dusty shipped to me. EXCELLENT Customer Service. Also excellent product. I missed him when he was gone. Welcome home little buddy!
customer_reviews.author: Ami Shaw

customer_reviews.title: The convenience!  Why did I wait so long!
customer_reviews.text: We have three small dogs, and I run this little "work horse" in my main areas. It saves me sooooo much time. I did have to put up cords and pick up dog toys--but small price to pay. Every 3 or 4 run, I have to clean the bin. This does the job. I will still have to vac bedrooms, but that is because there are to many cords or things in the way. So far, this works well...some people say it get's "stuck" or doesn't clean all areas, but so far, so good!
customer_reviews.author: Frances Bocksch

customer_reviews.title: Malfuntioned after 1 week! Disappointment but optimistic.
customer_reviews.text: I will be willing to come back to this rating after my warranty exchange. I bought this model after some research and talking with friends that own one. I was so excited. It worked amazingly for less than a week then starting having errors that could not be resolved even though nothing was actually wrong with it. I called the company and they are replacing the defective unit. I truly hope the next one works because when it works I absolutely love it. It is definitely a hassle to have to send it in and wait for a new one. :(
customer_reviews.author: Megan Elmblad

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Dang Good
customer_reviews.text: I am really happy with my Deebot. It was easy to set up and sync with my Echo Plus. The commands are simple, "Alexa, tell Deebot to start cleaning." It works pretty well going from my hardwood to my rugs. I have a dog and I am happy with the hair it picks up as well. Yes, you do have to change out the dust bin, but I only dump it twice for my downstairs, which is about 2,000 sq ft. The downside would be that when telling it to charge it gets lost a lot. It also gets easily stuck under my recliner, as if it can't account for the depth narrowing. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Beansy

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on floors
customer_reviews.text: It was definitely fun to watch and did a relatively good job. Obviously, as stated, it does not like rugs which is a problem. You have to block them off which is a hassle. Also, on my second day of using it, it got stuck on a piece of flat plastic and broke down and I’m yet to fix it. Customer service rep replied right away but unfortunately I am out of the country so can’t get it fixed at this time. Don’t know if it is a major fix or not. It turned off and won’t come back on again.
customer_reviews.author: Barbottawa

customer_reviews.title: Impressed Me!
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job, I even vacuumed first, before I tried it. I was amazed at how much additional dirt and hair it picked up. Very pleased. Purchased because I have back issues and vacuuming is very painful for me. This will be a great help! It is a little loud, and runs for more than an hour. It might be beneficial to run when you are out...or sleeping, lol. I just turn up the music. Dogs aren't bothered, just a little curious, but learned to get up on their beds and stay until it's done.
customer_reviews.author: Kimbers

customer_reviews.title: Not bad but not my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: Cons: I don’t like the random pattern. The vacuum would go down the same paths and keep missing the same areas, even starting from different points. It also got stuck and had a hard time finding “home” a few times. Does not replace a need for vacuuming. Not desirable if you have kids who leave crumbs everywhere( areas could get missed). Pros: It was quiet and did seem to pick up a good amount of dirt. I like that it has an app so I can turn it on when not home. Price isn’t too bad. It’s a good vacuum for some maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: You can get one year
customer_reviews.text: This works well but after one year, the dreaded 4 beeps started with every return to the charging station. It is meticulously cleaned after every use. This lasted 6 months, and now it doesn’t function at all. I have followed all recs on the Ecovac site and several YouTube videos. Customer service is excellent while under warranty and the first vacuum I received had the 4 beep problem out of the box. This was quickly replaced and I enjoyed one year of beepless good use.
customer_reviews.author: evaluation

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this vacuum for a little over a year and today it just stopped working. Very disappointed! It went from tile floor to carpet pretty smoothly, picked up dog hair so I’m highly disappointed that it stopped working. I’ll attempt to reach out to amazon and will give an update.
customer_reviews.author: aea0060

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: This item does not do the best job of picking up. If I have to sweep after it's done, what's the point? It doesn't connect to their app at all either. Despite them claiming they were trying to help me with the tech issues, they never actually did and just gave up and I finally did as well. Nothing was solved and I am stuck with something that does not do that great of a job. The auto feature seems to go to the same spots over and over again. I have to get the remote and guide it against its will which again means that I have to actively deal with it, so again, what's the point?
customer_reviews.author: D. and M.

customer_reviews.title: You Will Love This... for a Year
customer_reviews.text: The N79S was great. You set it on schedule and it cleans very well. It connects to your Wi-Fi. It will tell you when the consumables need to be replaced. You will love it... for a year. Slowly it goes blind. It bangs full force into objects and that becomes annoying quickly. The solution is to buff the front where the sensor is. I find myself doing this over and over. It works for a little while and then starts banging into things. Then one day, you'll get the dreaded 100 beeps. It returns to its cradle and is charging. Then it begins beeping and beeping and beeping. I have looked all over and found no solution for this problem.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cybulski

customer_reviews.title: Love my deebot
customer_reviews.text: I pick this up are one of those special Amazon days and got quite a deal. Doing some research I specifically chose this model because the newer ones had actually have less suction. I'm amazed no matter how many times I run it, it still picks up stuff. The only thing I can say bad, and it really is not it's fault, is I really wish it had mapping since my area is so big, that would help assure it gets everywhere. Deebot does have models with this feature, but I was only willing to spend a couple hundred so it's on me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Monica

customer_reviews.title: Cleans up cat hair very well but only worked for 9 months.
customer_reviews.text: This little vacuum robot really works well. I had the more expensive Roomba which I loved until it died. This works just as well. My only complaint is that the suction wheel area is much smaller than the Roomba so it does take more runs over the floors to get them clean. The battery lasts quite awhile and it obediently returns to its base when the battery needs recharging. Great product! Edit: 9 months later and it won't charge. Bummer. It was a cheap price and worked well when it worked but I think products should last longer than 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: JMadison

product_meta.title: Ecovacs DEEBOT N79S Robotic Vacuum Cleaner with Max Power Suction, Upto 110 Min Runtime, Hard Floors and Carpets, Works with Alexa, App Controls, Self-Charging, Quiet
product_meta.description: ECOVACS DEEBOT N79S Vacuum Cleaner takes care of vacuuming so you don't have to. Three cleaning modes and scheduling accessible from the ECOVACS Home App ensures an effortless, thorough clean while you do things you really love. Its low sound level allows you to have conversations or watch TV while it cleans. Max Mode double suction power to better clean your hard floors and carpets of dirt and dust when needed. The 520ml dustbin allows DEEBOT N79S to take full advantage of 110 minutes of runtime. DEEBOT N79S comes with a 1 year . Simply move cables and household items that could be on the floor out of the way to avoid entanglement. When the job is complete or DEEBOT N79S low on battery, with Auto Charging, it will return to its dock to prepare for the next cleaning. With Alexa and Google Assistant compatibility, utilize voice commands such as “Alexa, ask DEEBOT to start cleaning”. DEEBOT N79S also comes with an easy to use remote control.
feature_bullets: Ready for any mess: Equipped with two side brushes and a main brush, DEEBOT will sweep, lift, and vacuum to clean an entire floor (Auto mode), a small area (Spot mode), or the edge of your floor (Edge mode)

Voice & app controls: Alexa & Google Assistant voice commands. Ecovacs Smart App comes w/ 5+ advanced features including direct control, scheduling, status updates, cleaning modes, accessories status, etc
Max mode power: Increase suction power by upto 2X for particularly troublesome messes
Upto 110 minute run time: A longer battery life for even more cleaning Auto-return & charging means your robot will always be ready to clean
Standard: 1-year warranty. Comes w/ (1) charging dock, (4) dual-length side brushes, (2) high efficiency air filter, (1) remote control w/ battery), (1) cleaning tool, customer Support

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars11,200 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
